title: 106_hr588
content: ELIGIBLE EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS PERMITTED TO MAINTAIN QUALIFIED TUITION PROGRAMS; OTHER MODIFICATIONS OF QUALIFIED TUITION PROGRAMS. Eligible educational institutions can now maintain qualified tuition programs under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Technical amendments have been made to update references from "qualified State tuition programs" to "qualified tuition programs". Amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 have updated references from "qualified State tuition programs" to "qualified tuition programs" in various sections. Amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 have updated references from "qualified State tuition programs" to "qualified tuition programs" in various sections, including section headings and specific code sections. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 has been amended to update references to "qualified State tuition programs" to "qualified tuition programs" in various sections, including section headings and specific code sections such as SEC. 529. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 has been amended to update references to "qualified State tuition programs" to "qualified tuition programs" in various sections, including section headings and specific code sections such as SEC. 529. The item in the table of sections for part VIII of subchapter F of chapter 1 of the Code is amended by striking "State". Additionally, distributions for qualified higher education expenses under section 529(c)(3) are modified to exclude certain amounts from gross income. The amendment to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 updates references to "qualified State tuition programs" to "qualified tuition programs" and modifies distributions for qualified higher education expenses under section 529(c)(3) to exclude certain amounts from gross income. The amendment updates references in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to "qualified tuition programs" and modifies distributions for qualified higher education expenses under section 529(c)(3) to exclude certain amounts from gross income. Any distribution from a qualified tuition program is includible in the gross income of the distributee to the extent allocable to income under the program, but not includible in gross income to the extent allocable to investment in the contract. Clause (i) of section 529(c)(3)(C) is amended to allow transfers to another qualified tuition program for the designated beneficiary. These amendments take effect on January 1, 2000.
